beginner.explanation: Basic sentence structure: Ich (I) + bin (am) + müde (tired) + heute (today)
Der/Die/Das + Noun + ist/sind + Adjective is a fundamental German pattern

beginner.translation: I drink coffee in the morning
beginner.explanation: Notice 'am Morgen' (in the morning) - German uses 'am' with time periods

beginner.text: Die Katze schläft auf dem Sofa
beginner.translation: The cat sleeps on the sofa
beginner.explanation: auf + dem (dative) - prepositions change the case of nouns in German

intermediate.text: Ich habe gestern ein Buch gelesen
intermediate.explanation: German perfect tense: habe (helper) + gelesen (past participle) at the end

intermediate.text: Weil es regnet, bleibe ich zu Hause
intermediate.translation: Because it's raining, I stay at home
intermediate.explanation: 'Weil' sends the verb to the end. Notice comma before main clause.

intermediate.text: Der Mann, den ich gesehen habe, ist mein Lehrer
intermediate.translation: The man whom I saw is my teacher
intermediate.explanation: 'den' is accusative because the man is the object of 'gesehen habe'

advanced.text: Hätte ich mehr Zeit gehabt, wäre ich nach Deutschland gefahren
advanced.translation: If I had had more time, I would have gone to Germany
advanced.explanation: Hätte + past participle, wäre + past participle - expressing unreal past situations

advanced.text: Nachdem er das Studium abgeschlossen hatte, begann er zu arbeiten
advanced.translation: After he had finished his studies, he began to work
advanced.explanation: 'Nachdem' with plusquamperfekt (had + past participle) for completed past actions
